My code has two modes: "it works" and "I have no idea what's happening."
VS Code: 47 extensions. Productivity: questionable.
"Just one more semicolon," I said at 2am.
I don't always write tests, but when I do, I forget to run them.
Debugging is like being a detective in a crime movie where you're also the murderer.
My variable names are 80% of my codebase's personality.
npm install: the modern way to gamble your Saturday away.
I learned to code so I could automate... nothing. I still do everything manually.
"It's a feature, not a bug" — every student dev, ever.
I spent more time choosing a terminal theme than learning git rebase.
My code compiles. I am become death, destroyer of bugs.
IDE said "this will never work" and honestly? Fair.
I have 12 browser tabs open. None of them are the documentation.
Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V is my debugging workflow.
My TODO list is just a museum of abandoned ideas.
I don't make mistakes. I create learning opportunities.
"It works on Linux" — well, good for Linux.
I wrote a function. I wrote another function. Now I have two problems.
The rubber duck on my desk knows more about my code than I do.
I'm not lazy; I just prefer to code inefficiently and call it "brute force."
